paper.title: Yet Another Application for Topie: Verification of Mutual Exclusion Algorithms

paper.abstract: Toupie is a finite domain μ-calculus model checker that uses extended decision diagrams to represent relations and formulae. In recent papers, we have demonstrated that such a language can model and solve difficult problems, such as AI Puzzles, Abstract Interpretation of Logic Programs with very good running times. Hereafter we show how, in Toupie, one can handle transition systems and check properties of Mutual Exclusion Algorithms.
